com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation

Class BulkFitnessFunctionMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgapcustomised.BulkFitnessFunction
      • com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.AHNIFitnessFunction
        • com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.BulkFitnessFunctionMT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BainNNConnectionCountCost, BainNNConnectionLengthCost, CPPNSizeCost, DoublePoleBalancing, GenericBehaviourEvaluator, HyperNEATFitnessFunction, RLContinuousStateBased, RLRecurrentNetworkBased, RLStateBased, TargetFitnessFunctionMT, TMaze

    public abstract class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
extends AHNIFitnessFunction
implements Configurable

    Provides a base for multi-threaded bulk fitness functions. Provides a multi-threaded framework for performing evaluations on multiple genomes. The methods evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int) must be implemented in subclasses. Subclasses may also need to override the methods init(Properties), initialiseEvaluation(), finaliseEvaluation(), postEvaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int), fitnessObjectivesCount(), noveltyObjectiveCount() and dispose(). Subclasses may also need to override AHNIFitnessFunction.getLayerDimensions(int, int) or AHNIFitnessFunction.getNeuronPositions(int, int) to specify required layer dimensions or neuron positions, for example for input or output layers.

    See TargetFitnessFunctionMT for an example.

    Author:
    Oliver Coleman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_THREADS_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String MIN_THREADS_KEY
        Property key for minimum number of threads to use for fitness evaluation (including transcription of genotype/cppn to phenotype/substrate).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_THREADS_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String MAX_THREADS_KEY
        Property key for maximum number of threads to use for fitness evaluation (including transcription of genotype/cppn to phenotype/substrate). If value is <= 0 then which ever is lower of the detected number of processor cores and the specified minimum will be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MULTI_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String MULTI_KEY
        Property key for specifying additional fitness function classes in a multi-objective evaluation. Note that these fitness functions must extend BulkFitnessFunctionMT.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MULTI_WEIGHTING_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String MULTI_WEIGHTING_KEY
        The overall fitness will be assigned to each individual according to a weighted sum of the fitness values provided by each fitness function, according to the weightings provided here. If not specified then each objective will have equal weighting. Must be a comma-separated list of weight values. The first value should correspond to the primary fitness function specified by fitness_function.class followed by a weight value for each function specified by fitness.function.multi.class. For all fitness functions that define a novelty behaviour the weighting for these must be included at the end of this list in the same order as the functions are declared by fitness.function.multi.class. Note that a NaturalSelector (eg NSGA-II selector) may set the overall fitness to something else based on the multiple objectives, in which case the weightings here will be ignored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • init

      • initialiseEvaluation

        public void initialiseEvaluation()
        If required, initialise data for the current evaluation run. This method is called at the beginning of evaluate(List). It should be overridden if data (eg input and/or output patterns) need to be set-up before every evaluation run.

      • finaliseEvaluation

        public void finaliseEvaluation()
        If required, perform cleanup after the current evaluation run. This method is called at the end of evaluate(List).

      • noveltyObjectiveCount

        public int noveltyObjectiveCount()
        This is akin to getNoveltyObjectiveCount() but allows for handling multiple fitness functions, some of which may define multiple novelty objectives. Subclasses that support novelty search should override this method and return the number of behaviours this fitness function defines. This default implementation returns 0.
        See Also:
        NoveltySearch, fitnessObjectivesCount()

      • fitnessObjectivesCount

        public int fitnessObjectivesCount()
        This is akin to getObjectiveCount() but allows for handling multiple fitness functions, some of which may define multiple objectives. This default implementation returns 1. If the fitness function defines more than one fitness objective, or no fitness objectives (eg only a novelty objective), then this method must be overridden to return the number of fitness objectives defined. NOTE: unlike getObjectiveCount() this method should not include the number of novelty objectives.
        See Also:
        noveltyObjectiveCount()

      • getObjectiveCount

        public final int getObjectiveCount()

        This implementation is set as final to allow this class to make use of multiple separate fitness functions for a multi-objective setup.

        Overrides:
        getObjectiveCount in class BulkFitnessFunction
        Returns:
        Returns the number of objectives being employed. This is only valid for fitness functions and NaturalSelectors that handle multiple objectives. This default implementation returns 1. NOTE: the returned value should include the number of regular fitness objectives PLUS the number of novelty objectives (see BulkFitnessFunction.getNoveltyObjectiveCount()).
        See Also:
        fitnessObjectivesCount(), noveltyObjectiveCount()

      • getNoveltyObjectiveCount

        public final int getNoveltyObjectiveCount()

        This implementation is set as final to allow this class to make use of multiple separate fitness functions for a multi-objective setup.

        Overrides:
        getNoveltyObjectiveCount in class BulkFitnessFunction
        Returns:
        Returns the number of novelty objectives being employed. This is only valid for fitness functions that define novelty behaviours. This default implementation returns 0.
        See Also:
        fitnessObjectivesCount(), noveltyObjectiveCount()

      • fitnessValuesStable

        public boolean fitnessValuesStable()
        If the fitness value(s) and behaviour(s) for novelty search (if used) for this fitness function do not change between generations then subclasses should override this method to return true in order to avoid unnecessarily recalculating the fitness value(s) or behaviour(s). This default implementation returns false.
        See Also:
        fitnessObjectivesCount()

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(java.util.List<Chromosome> genotypes)
        Evaluate a set of chromosomes.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        genotypes - The set of chromosomes to evaluate.

      • evaluate

        protected double evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
              Activator substrate,
              int evalThreadIndex)
        Evaluate an individual genotype on one fitness objective (if more than one fitness objective is defined by this fitness function and/or it defines a behaviour for novelty search then evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int, double[], Behaviour[]) must be overridden instead). This method is called from evaluate(List) and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes. If the fitness function defines a performance value then this method should call Chromosome.setPerformanceValue(double). In a multi-objective set-up only the performance defined by the primary fitness function will be used. If a performance value isn't defined it will be set to the overall fitness value. This default implementation returns 0.
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        Returns:
        The fitness value, in the range [0, 1]. Note that if novelty is the only objective then the returned value is ignored.

      • evaluate

        protected void evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
            Activator substrate,
            int evalThreadIndex,
            double[] fitnessValues,
            Behaviour[] behaviours)
        For fitness functions that define multiple fitness objectives (see fitnessObjectivesCount()) and/or behaviours for novelty search (see noveltyObjectiveCount()), evaluate an individual genotype over all of these objectives. This default implementation simply calls evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int). If the fitness function defines a performance value then this method should call Chromosome.setPerformanceValue(double). In a multi-objective set-up (see MULTI_KEY) only the performance defined by the primary fitness function will be used. If a performance value isn't defined it will be set to the (first) fitness value given by the primary fitness function.
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        fitnessValues - An array to hold the fitness value(s) as determined by this fitness function. The array will have length fitnessObjectivesCount().
        behaviours - An array to hold the behaviour(s) for novelty search as determined by this fitness function. The array will have length noveltyObjectiveCount(), and can be safely ignored if this method returns 0.

      • getNumThreads

        public int getNumThreads()

      • endRun

        public boolean endRun()
        Specified by:
        endRun in class BulkFitnessFunction
        Returns:
        Return true when an evolutionary run should be completed before the maximum number of generations is complete, false otherwise.

      • generateSubstrate

        public Activator generateSubstrate(Chromosome chrom,
                          Activator substrate)
                            throws TranscriberException
        A convenience method to generate a substrate from the given Chromosome using the configured transcriber for this fitness function.
        Parameters:
        chrom - The Chromosome to generate the substrate from.
        substrate - If a substrate can be reused for efficiency reasons it can be supplied here, otherwise null may be given.
        Throws:
        TranscriberException

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
            Activator substrate,
            java.lang.String baseFileName,
            boolean logText,
            boolean logImage)
        This method may optionally be overridden to perform an evaluation of an individual genotype and output the results to a log. The evaluation is not used for any purpose other than generating a record of the evaluation of the given genotype. This implementation will generate images for the novelty archive(s) if possible. If called multiple times in the same generation it will only generate images the first time. If overridden, subclasses should call this method from their own implementation.
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class AHNIFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        baseFileName - The base/prefix of the names of log file(s) that should be created.
        logText - If true then text representations should be output.
        logImage - If true then image representations should be output.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Sub-classes may override this method to dispose of resources upon disposal of this object.
        Specified by:
        dispose in class BulkFitnessFunction

      • postEvaluate

        protected void postEvaluate(Chromosome genotype,
                Activator substrate,
                int evalThreadIndex)
        Sub-classes may override this method to perform operations after a Chromosome has been evaluated.
        Parameters:
        genotype - the Chromosome that has been evaluated. It's fitness and performance will have been set.
        substrate - the network (activator), or phenotype, of the evaluated Chromosome.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.

      • evolutionFinished

        @Deprecated
public void evolutionFinished(HyperNEATEvolver evolver)
        Deprecated. 

        Deprecated in favour of event listeners such as GeneticEventListener or AHNIEventListener.

        This method is called when an evolutionary run has finished. It can be used to perform testing or other analysis on the fittest and/or best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.

        This default implementation does nothing.
        Specified by:
        evolutionFinished in class BulkFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        evolver - Methods on this object can be used to obtain the fittest and best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.
